text:
Sure, you can require JS files from your theme in your `meta.json` and also require it directly in your `module.html` e.g.:

```{{ require_js('<https://maps.googleapis.com/maps/api/js?key=>' ~ module.google_api_key) }}```
Thanks. For some reason HubSpot doesn't want to load a offsite JS library, not sure why.

*PSA:* For those who might have been stifled when trying to get the <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-react-boilerplate|HubSpot React Boilerplate> up and running - there is a new release and update for `hs create react-app` CLI command to address the install problems with node-sass.

It should be nice and easy to get a react app module running in HubSpot now.

Big thanks to Tim Finley  and <@U26AKMZ19> for the speedy code review and update. cc <@U7SL518D6>

Hi
can i use this?
let ownerid=454545;
HubSpotClient.crm.owners.basicApi.getById(ownerid, ["email", "firstName"])

it is working
HubSpotClient.crm.contacts.basicApi.getById(event["object"]["objectId"], ["email", "phone"])
